bibl.author: William Sloane Kennedy
bibl.title: William Sloane Kennedy to Walt Whitman, 31 March 1890
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839-1919, Library of Congress, Washington, DC.

body.p: Yesterday (Sunday afternoon) read again with deepest interest the Songs of Parting. I keep touching deeper + not before understood tho'ts with my plummet in reading you,—espec. in these hymns of the Infinite. The productions of Homer + Milton seem quite boyish in comparison with the profound closing L. of G. It is a refreshing draught to me after the bafflement of the week in newspapers. Be sure to read Tyndall's fascinating long article of reminiscences of Carlyle in January Fortnightly.
